subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Scott Gordon, who most recently was the coach of the Providence Bruins in the American Hockey League, was named Tuesday as the Islanders’ new head coach. Gordon, the A.H.L. coach of the year in 2008, agreed to a multiyear contract. Gordon, 45, was selected over two coaches who have previous N.H.L. experience, Bob Hartley and Paul Maurice. Gordon succeeds Ted Nolan, who was fired July 14 because of philosophical differences with Garth Snow, the general manager. Gordon led Providence to a 55-18-3 record last season, the best in the league. He was its head coach for five seasons. He played in 23 N.H.L. games as a goaltender for the Quebec Nordiques.
